title: 070 Shake and Courtney Love Cover Tim Buckley’s “Song to the Siren”: Listen
description: Hole’s Melissa Auf der Maur also contributes to the new recording of the 1970 song
author: Matthew Strauss
excerpt: Hole’s Melissa Auf der Maur also contributes to the new recording of the 1970 song
text: Petrichor, the new album from 070 Shake, has arrived, and with it comes the musician’s cover of Tim Buckley’s “Song to the Siren.” The cover features Hole’s Courtney Love and Melissa Auf der Maur. Listen to the new “Song to the Siren”—co-produced by Dave Hamelin, Eg White, and Johan Lenox—below.Petrichor is 070 Shake’s first album since 2022’s You Can’t Kill Me. Revisit Pitchfork’s feature “070 Shake Moves Beyond the Buzz.”
html:
Petrichor, the new album from 070 Shake, has arrived, and with it comes the musician’s cover of Tim Buckley’s “Song to the Siren.” The cover features Hole’s Courtney Love and Melissa Auf der Maur. Listen to the new “Song to the Siren”—co-produced by Dave Hamelin, Eg White, and Johan Lenox—below.

Petrichor is 070 Shake’s first album since 2022’s You Can’t Kill Me. Revisit Pitchfork’s feature “070 Shake Moves Beyond the Buzz.”
